reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an epic tale of 1 brave hero. The twists in this book need an applause and the story itself was so addicting. I absolutely loved this book. Nice and easy read, very well written. I HOPE there's a book 2 in the making!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book is about the coming of age for a young man in a dystopia future .
reviews.reviewText: This Author is one of my favorite in the young adult genre . This author knows how to write a great if not fantastic story that will leave a lasting impact on his readers . I truly enjoyed this one and I'm looking forward to other work by you although I do think that this story deserves at least another book .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The plot is never what you think it is!
reviews.reviewText: Very well written. I never could've imagined the ending until it happened. This story is full of twists and turns and there's a huge surprise at the ending!There could definitely be a second book to this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Challenge of Spreading the Word
reviews.reviewText: An orphan boy is raised by his uncle, the Grand Protector. His love of reading ancient books in the library leads him to be a knowledge seeker. The Kingdom is attacked and Eodain is sent away with a memory device. The intent is to find what may be the last ground station connected to what is left of a satellite network.The twist at the end of the book surprised me in that what we hope are our friends to support a higher purpose, their intentions are not what they appear. However, Eodain maintains his mission to pass the knowledge of the written word on to all in the world.I received The Knowledge Seeker for an honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Would make a great futuristic dystopian movie!
reviews.reviewText: Wow! Just wow! Adventure, betrayals, twists and turns, truths mixed with mistruths, romance—this story has it all! Who is telling the truth, and who is not? Were the Enlightened ones really so Enlightened? The author messes with your mind through misleading memories and experiences. Who is good and who is evil? What is right and what is wrong? An excellent, thoughtful saga. It would make a great movie! I received a free copy from the author and am pleased to leave a review.

reviews.reviewTitle: A refreshing new dystopian novel with surprises galore!
reviews.reviewText: I've been a fan of Knightly's middle grade Ben Archer series and was keen to try her YA novel, The Knowledge Seeker. What a ride from start to finish! I love the world building of this novel, far into the future, where the Enlightened People have left behind knowledge which is fiercely guarded at the Atheneum by the Knowledge Seekers with Uncle Denesius at the helm. When the safety of the Atheneum and all it contains is at risk, Termite, aka Eodain, sets out on a perilous journey to protect the last Talisman. He is accompanied by a motley crew. This story had a Brotherhood of the Ring vibe but in a more hostile and chilling environment with the Roarim's Wraith Lord and the Pirate Lord both nipping at Eodain's heels. The ending caught me utterly by surprise and, in my opinion, are the best kinds of stories! It all fell into place in the last few chapters and left me wanting to read more about the main character, Eodain and his love interest, Elysa. What I especially appreciated was that the story did not end on a happily-ever-after, but a hopeful note. I certainly hope there's book two in this fantastic world. Highly recommended!
O título da capa está um pouco corto, pelo que parece erro de impressão.Não obstante, veio sem rasgões e o interior em boas condições.Resta ler 📖
